posts.cooked:
Now that more and more people are using Signal and there are larger groups to join, one annoyance that is becoming apparent is the multitude of housekeeping notices.

A couple of large groups I am in regularly fill up the conversation screen with notices for joiners/leavers, security number changes, name changes and so on. In groups that can have several hundred people, this is flooding the conversation screen.

It would be nice if such housekeeping messages could be collapsed and expanded at will (perhaps with a setting to collapse any new notices immediately too), much like Element does it.

link_counts.title: Option to disable added and removed messages from group chats
Add Group Setting to hide name changes
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 5.32 release

posts.name: AlertSubject
posts.cooked:
1080√ó4192 123 KB

Maybe all those events can be collapsed into one single one that says ‚Äúmultiple membership changes‚Äù and can be expanded
And maybe notifications shouldn‚Äôt be sent out a thousand times if one person decides to be a troll
Not sure how to achieve that though

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 5.32 release
When blocking a user, please also block "user has requested to join a group" messages

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Completely agree. Shouldn‚Äôt member requests not really matter in a group chat outside of maybe a banner or something not as noticable? This makes it really easy for people to troll.

Whatnoww:

Shouldn‚Äôt member requests not really matter in a group chat outside of maybe a banner or something not as noticable?

Requests maybe, but these are join/leave notifications. Leave notifications aren‚Äôt so important, but join notifications can be very important because you may need to be aware of who is in the group ‚Äì you don‚Äôt want a malicious user to be able to silently join after somehow obtaining a group link, for example.

posts.name: Navneet Vikram Tey
posts.cooked: I agree but one must be allowed to toggle what kind of notifications one want and be able to see collapsed membership changes. This rn is ugly and more ‚Äútroll efficient‚Äù

Requests can be spammed too:

1024√ó1850 112 KB

The spammers are exposing a number of flaws with Signal when it comes to large public groups. Kudos to them for beta testing.

Maybe until the devs join some of these groups or run one as an admin and experience the irritation for themselves, some of the changes required might not receive the priority. For example, devs joined the official Mobilecoin group and iOS now has updates to help with performance in large groups.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Just got spammed. Makes it impossible to keep group links open at all. Why can‚Äôt we ban a user from requesting to join?

Turn on the admin approval for joining as a temporary solution.
But I agree the OP‚Äôs proposal anyway.

Just want to chime in and ask for the priority of this feature request to be boosted

The above grifter is spamming groups I‚Äôm in too, with hundreds of pages of requests and cancel request to join. It makes these groups quite unusable, it‚Äôs awful

posts.name: üëäüá∫üá∏üî•
posts.cooked: I‚Äôd strongly recommend temporarily changing the group links, not posting them, and everyone report this person as spam if you get a DM.

Avitus:

report this person as spam.

There are a lot of websites showing sms received to the phone numbers that they have. This is some stalker behavior and not a mass spammer. A ban list based on ACI/e164 or reporting spam or changing group links are all only temporary bandaids (ordered by most to least useful).

posts.name: anon53652
posts.cooked:
I can (manually, unfortunately) clean up the groups on my phone by deleting all these notification messages. Unfortunately I can‚Äôt do that on desktop, I would propose:

  1. Add in desktop the option to delete them
  2. Create something like the all media list in Signal Android for notifications with a "select all‚Äô‚Äô button so I can quickly get rid of all these messages clogging up my screen and memory. For large groups with message expire these things should expire as well IMO.

You don‚Äôt have these groups on mute? I think one of the spammers even rang the entire Mobilecoin group. That must have been fun for some people.

anon53652:

Unfortunately I can‚Äôt do that on desktop,

You can but you have to do it one by one. Desktop really needs a multi-select.
